I remember reading that the first use of the Gatling gun was during the NY 
Draft Riots in 1863.  But perhaps Prof Murphy was referring to its first use on 
the battlefield?

Bob Burke


In a message dated 1/14/04 1:07:11 AM, murphymurphyjohn@... writes:

<< The Gatling gun was apparently first used at Petersburg, VA, in the 
American 
Civil War in 1864-5.  It was formally adopted in 1866 by the US Army.  
Indeed, 
one of the factors that brought about Custer's disastrous defeat in 1876 was 
that he apparently disdained to bring along a Gatling gun detachment because 
it would slow  him up!  Thus,  it is entirely possible that a friendly 
country 
like Meiji Japan could have been shipped some by the 1877 rebellion.  Prof 
Murf >>
